item.title: Binary Exponentiation
item.description: Binary exponentiation, also known as exponentiation-by-squaring, is a fast method to compute powers of a number. The algorithm looks like this: $$ x^{n} = \begin{cases} x(x^2)^{\frac{n-1}{2}}, & \text{if } n \text{ is odd} \\\ (x^2)^{\frac{n}{2}}, & \text{if } n \text{ is even} \end{cases} $$ But why does this work? Well, the idea behind this method is exploiting some of the properties of its binary representation to do less work.
